timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,59 @@
+/*******************************************************************************
+ * Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+ * All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials

+ * which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+ * http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+ *
+ * Contributors:
+ *     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+ *******************************************************************************/
+package componenttest.rules.repeater;
+
+import java.util.Collections;
+import java.util.HashSet;
+import java.util.Set;
+
+public class RepeatFeatureSet {

timeline.bodyText:
I worry a little that this will confuse people, since it looks similar to the methods on FeatureReplacementAction but it works differently.
I do like the ability to take an modify an existing feature set.
I don't like that you can add features to an existing feature set without changing the ID.
I think it would be better if the ID had to be provided in the constructor, but you could copy the feature list from another set. E.g:
new RepeatFeatureSet(ID).addAllFrom(MP40).remove("mpConfig-2.0").add("mpConfig-2.0");

However, this wouldn't stop someone doing this and getting a featureset with the MP4.0 ID.
MP40.add("someOtherFeature");

Not sure if you can prevent that without using a builder pattern.
timeline.author: Azquelt

replies.bodyText: went with a partial builder pattern
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.bodyText: Javadoc (particularly important here as the meaning of allFeatureSets and otherFeatureSetsTestMode isn't particularly intuitive)
timeline.author: Azquelt
timeline.diffHunk:

+    public static RepeatTests repeat(String server, TestMode otherFeatureSetsTestMode, Set<FeatureSet> allFeatureSets, FeatureSet firstFeatureSet, FeatureSet... otherFeatureSets) {
+        RepeatTests r = RepeatTests.with(forFeatureSet(allFeatureSets, firstFeatureSet, server, TestMode.LITE));
+        for (int i = 0; i < otherFeatureSets.length; i++) {
+            r = r.andWith(forFeatureSet(allFeatureSets, otherFeatureSets[i], server, otherFeatureSetsTestMode));
+        }
+        return r;
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * @param  allFeatureSets
+     * @param  version
+     * @param  server
+     * @param  testMode
+     * @return
+     */
+    public static FeatureReplacementAction forFeatureSet(Set<FeatureSet> allFeatureSets, FeatureSet version, String server, TestMode testMode) {

timeline.bodyText: Ideally these methods would have Javadoc too, though I think the class is fairly intuitive. Otherwise I'd take the tags out completely.
timeline.author: Azquelt

timeline.bodyText: We should probably document what equality means for this class if we're overriding equals and hashCode
timeline.author: Azquelt

timeline.bodyText: The old config was equivalent to MP14, rather than MP20. Probably unimportant but was this a deliberate change?
timeline.author: Azquelt

replies.bodyText: This one is a mistake, will change it
replies.author: tevans78

timeline.author: Azquelt

timeline.bodyText: These tests are only supposed to run against 1.x, and I think LATEST would make them run against 2.0
timeline.author: Azquelt

timeline.bodyText:
I think the design of this method was to repeat for Fault Tolerance 2.0 and above, rather than MP 2.0 and above (because the FT core was rewritten for FT 2.0).
It should not include MP20 - the rest is correct.
timeline.author: Azquelt

timeline.message:
Create generic MP Repeat Actions.
Also reduces the MP Config RepeatTests down to just the standard MicroProfile FeatureSets.
Fix FT tests to only use appSecurity-2.0 where needed

Create generic MP Repeat Actions.
Also reduces the MP Config RepeatTests down to just the standard MicroProfile FeatureSets.
Fix FT tests to only use appSecurity-2.0 where needed
Fix some FT FAT bucket issues
Fix some FT FAT bucket issues
